title: On Imagination - significance of the imagery

content.question: Which of the following statements most precisely characterizes the significance of the imagery in the fifth stanza (lines 23-32)?

choices.label: The reality of winter intensifies the resurgence of hope that attends the arrival of spring.
Two personifications—one harsh, one inspirational—confront each other in a mythic struggle for victory.
Classical divinities of nature illustrate the fallacy that nature sympathizes with human emotion.
Envisioned as powerful even over nature, Imagination seems to transform winter into spring.

content.answer: Envisioned as powerful even over nature, Imagination seems to transform winter into spring.

skill.text: Skill 5.D: Identify and explain the function of an image or imagery.
